content.user_title: Avoid React Pitfalls with Best Practices
content.value_statement: React developers often encounter common mistakes that cause bugs and accessibility issues. This skill provides proven patterns for components, forms, error handling, and responsive design.
actual_capabilities: Provides React component patterns and code examples
Shows proper form validation with Zod and React Hook Form
Guides error boundary implementation for graceful degradation
Covers accessibility best practices with ARIA labels
limitations: Does not execute or test React code
Does not modify existing project files
Does not generate complete React applications from scratch
Does not access external APIs or documentation

prompt_templates.title: Component Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this React component code and identify any anti-patterns or mistakes according to React best practices. Check for proper loading/error states, data checks, useEffect usage, and accessibility issues.

prompt_templates.title: Form Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me implement a form with proper validation using Zod schemas and React Hook Form. Include inline error display and disabled submit state while validating.

prompt_templates.title: Error Handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an error boundary component for wrapping major sections of my React app. Include proper error logging and a retry mechanism for graceful degradation.

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my React component for accessibility issues. Check for ARIA labels, keyboard navigation support, semantic HTML, and focus indicators.

output_examples.input: Help me fix the issues in this React component that has missing error states and no accessibility features
output: • Loading state not handled - add conditional rendering before data access
• No error boundary wrapping the component
• Buttons use div with onClick instead of semantic button elements
• Recommended fix: Add Skeleton loader, ErrorCard fallback, use semantic HTML buttons

best_practices: Always check data existence before accessing properties to prevent runtime errors
Implement proper loading and error states with separate UI components
Use semantic HTML elements and ARIA labels for accessibility
Define helper functions before use in component body or export them
anti_patterns: Defining functions inside JSX render or onClick handlers
Using window.location.href for navigation instead of router Link
Accessing data properties without null checks on optional data
Using div elements with onClick instead of semantic button elements

faq.question: Which React versions are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns apply to React 16.8+ with hooks. Class components shown for error boundaries are still valid.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and code examples. It does not execute code or modify your project files.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with Next.js?
faq.answer: Yes, patterns work with Next.js. Use Link from next/link for navigation instead of wouter.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
